result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court set $50 monthly payment, with higher payments towards end of probation term
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

records.addlTxt:
08:35 a.m. Defendant Craig Evans in court with attorney John Voorhees.  Defendant Craig Evans in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of revocation packet. Schiek/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court sentence
Jail - 8 months CC with any other sentence in any county
Jail credit - 123 days
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 8:48 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

1:59 pm. Defendant Craig Evans in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf57 and 16cm164. State moves to dismiss 16cm164 - Granted. State moves to amend Count 1 in 16cf57 to misdemeanor retail theft - Granted.  Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea. Schiek/Hogan/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 12 months cc with any current supervision 
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees-Court remits costs
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Restitution - $971.19 (includes 10%). Court sets $50 monthly payment, with higher payments towards end of probation term or probation to be extended.
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. 

Defendant to submit to booking process today in 16cm164.
Adj. 2:15 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

3:09 p.m. Defendant Craig Evans in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm164 and 16cf57.  In 16cm164,  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Court sets $ bond. Hogan statement that negotiations with State; believes resolution is close. In 16cf57 Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Information to be filed that mirrors complaint - waives further reading and enters not guilty plea.  Hogan motion to modify bond to remove no contact - Schiek statement that waiver has been filed. Adj. 3:12 p.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
No entry upon Trig's premises. No contact with Audrey LaPuma at residence, except telephone contact is allowed. Contact at jail is allowed.

1:21 p.m. Defendant Craig Evans in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint to be provided, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig  bond. Adj. 1:25 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
